intro: Comesperma esulifolium, commonly known as the slender-flowered comesperma, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments. It produces woody pods that contain small, hard seeds. This species is of interest in ecological studies due to its role in supporting local biodiversity.
